items.description: Somerset coast at Porlock Weir
items.message:
The Flood Alert for this area has now been removed. 
Tidal conditions are improving and should not require a further Alert for this area during the current spring tide sequence. 
We continue to monitor the situation. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads.
Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

items.description: Climping Seafront
items.message:
Flooding is possible in this area.

Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Avoid using low lying footpaths or entering areas prone to flooding. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.

items.message: This flood alert has been removed as tides have peaked and are now receding. No further impacts are expected from the current period of spring tides but we will continue to monitor levels closely. There may still be some areas where tidal flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.

We continue to monitor the situation. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads.
Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.
